title: Sarkozy verdict reveals complicated relationship between the French, politicians and judges
subhead: Following the conviction of France's former president, attacks on judges have returned to the political discourse. Yet this court decision is also the result of growing public demand for integrity.

title: Charlie Kirk's memorial through the lens of photographer Stacy Kranitz: 'The first few hours felt like a megachurch service'
subhead: Stacy Kranitz, an American photographer born in 1974, covered the memorial ceremony for the ultraconservative activist on September 21 for Le Monde. She reflects on this spectacular event, which combined politics with religion.

title: French artists and feminists call to honor women who died of illegal abortions
subhead: Activists are calling to build a monument in Paris to honor the women who died from unsafe abortions before abortion was legalized in France in 1975.

title: The day Sarkozy learned he was going to prison
subhead: Nicolas Sarkozy will become the first former president of the French Republic to sleep behind bars after being convicted of criminal conspiracy, in the case of alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 presidential campaign.
